title: Runeterra has SIX different apocalypse events

replies.body:
Just your average Tuesday on Runeterra.

"Hi, Steve. Who's ending the world today?"

"Seems like the Void is going to shattered the planet next. Oh well, want to grab some Ionian grub afterwards?"

"Yeah I'm down. Hopefully the Darkin left my favorite restaurant intact."

The Void is the main threat to Runeterra going forward, Riot already said that. So everything will be overshadowed by them from now until the lore ends (which will never happen). Secondly the Darkin if there really are only 5 left aren't a World Ending threat ({{champion:266}} despite this guy wanting to end the world so he can die.) Finally Morde is up for a VGU at some point so if you wait he will become an even bigger threat than he currently is. He is only not a threat because his lore is outdated so in a way he technically doesn't exist yet. He isn't being ignored they just have to get to him at some point.

{{champion:127}} as an Iceborn is probably affiliated with the Void. We knew this already because the Frozen Watchers are the masters of the Void and she serves them but now with the Ascended literally being called the "Sunborn" we can extrapolate that the Iceborn are the Freljord equivalent albeit on the Void side of the conflict.

The major threats (Actual world ending potential): {{champion:136}}, the Void ({{champion:127}} included) and an inevitable Rune War II.

The big threats (could be catastrophic and disrupt the stability of Runeterra): Xerath, The Shadow Isles, The Darkin and maybe even Noxus invading more of the world. Although this could be a good thing if it means a more unified Runeterra can stand against the Void when it eventually comes full force.

Localized threats: all the one off villains and factions that want to do harm: {{champion:134}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:41}} 
{{champion:202}}  etc etc

> [{quoted}](name=mrmeddyman,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EozzzaTs,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-07-09T21:42:05.075+0000)

We knew this already because the Frozen Watchers are the masters of the Void and she serves them but now with the Ascended literally being called the "Sunborn" we can extrapolate that the Iceborn are the Freljord equivalent albeit on the Void side of the conflict.
 

What.

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

The frozen watchers were confirmed as being from the Void. So, ultimately, the Ascended and the Iceborn are tied to the Void conflict, as are the Darkin. So far, there is no obvious connection to the Shadow Isles, but don't be shocked if/when it shows up.

But for real, I haven't read Veigars lore but isn't he called 'the tiny master of evil'. Isn't he gonna get into the world ending action all the kids fuss about these days

Wait, you thought that an old man would have that the kind of strength to break a mountain  with nothing but his bare hands would be a 100% human?

Welcome to Runeterra.

Have an apocalypse.

Technically the Darkin and Ascended are the same. So, that counts as the same: Ascededs killing everyone. 

And the Void works for the Watchers... so,its the same.

And Veigar, dont forget the tiny master of EVIL
The Void working for the Watchers is still cannon? I remember that the only clue we had was a image looking similar to {{champion:161}} , and nothing else.

Actually it only became canon a few months ago,with the release of Kai'sa,when they updated the page for the void on the universe page,where we got this quote:

> Screaming into existence with the birth of the universe, the Void is a manifestation of the unknowable nothingness that lies beyond. It is a force of insatiable hunger, waiting through the eons until **its masters, the mysterious Watchers**, mark the final time of undoing.


https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_GB/region/void/

> [{quoted}](name=Johnny El Rojo,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EozzzaTs,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2018-07-09T22:06:45.205+0000)

> [{quoted}](name=Ebonmaw Dragon,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EozzzaTs,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2018-07-09T21:59:27.379+0000)
>

> 
> And the Void works for the Watchers... so,its the same.
> 
> And Veigar, dont forget the tiny master of EVIL

I vote Veigar for ultimate Evil Overlord of Runeterra.
Heck, he only wants to rule the world instead of destroying it so that makes him a better pick than at least 2 factions.

You’re missing Aurelion Sol who’s current plan is to set Runeterra ablaze to free himself. 

At least that’s where his lore left off. Gonna go out on a limb and say that’s not what he will do when he arrives but still. 

But yeah, the lore went on an “ancient magic evil” spree where scratch the surface of just about any territories lore, you’ll find an ancient magic evil that will either destroy the world or corrupt it or whatever. 

As someone who’s not particularly interested in ancient magic evils. This has been a bit disappointing for me.

Elise isn't that connected to the Shadow Isles. Her old lore was, her newer lore has her as a member of the Black Rose in Noxus, who happened to achieve immortal beauty through a constant sacrifice to Vilemaw. She's only using the Isles to maintain her house's power in Noxus, but she is by no means to be lumped in with the undead there.

Maokai also is not to be lumped in with the undead. He's the last vessel of all the life on the Isles, so he's seeking to exterminate the undead and reinhabit the Isles with life and beauty.

Elise is a champion of the Shadow Isles. That's where her powers come from, and that's where Vilemaw is.

Her connection to Noxus is thin. She's not a true member of the Black Rose, but an ally using Rose cultists as blood sacrifices, whilst helping out LeBlanc in turn. She deals with them purely out of convenience: if they stopped supplying her with thralls, she'd search for another benefactor. It's like saying that Karthus is a Noxian champion because he was born in Noxus and served as a priest.

She doesn't care about her noble houses, either; her palace is dilapidated and she's had no political presence for centuries. Ultimately, her only real interest is in herself.

That's her old lore. Her new lore has her as a sort of Dorian Gray who maintains her looks and life by sacrificing to Vilemaw. She's connected to the Isles because she has to constantly bring sacrifices to Vilemaw, and does so under the guise of being a devout woman leading people to her god, but ultimately, her seat of power and place of operation is in Noxus. The Shadow Isles to her are merely a tool to perpetuate her lifestyle, where she's a member of the Black Rose in Noxus, in a noble house. 
To say Elise is a Shadow Isles champ at this point is incorrect, because she still lives and goes about her daily life in Noxus with the Black Rose.

> The Shadow Isles to her are merely a tool to perpetuate her lifestyle-

Isn't everything a tool to her? She's obsessed with preserving her eternal youth, and has no true allegiance to any faction.

Elise doesn't have "old" and "new" lore: her updated biography doesn't retcon anything previously known about her, she's been listed as an ally of Vladimir and LeBlanc for years, and her only connection to the Shadow Isles has always been through Vilemaw. However, it's still just an expansion on her previous story; Riot themselves still consider her to be a Shadow Isles champion.

This doesn't mean that she's closely related to the other Shadow Isles characters, but unless Riot openly states that everything before her new biography and short story is non-canon, calling her a pure Noxian champion isn't really correct.

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EozzzaTs,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-07-09T20:23:11.054+0000)

She's only using the Isles to maintain her house's power in Noxus, but she is by no means to be lumped in with the undead there.

> Maokai also is not to be lumped in with the undead. He's the last vessel of all the life on the Isles, so he's seeking to exterminate the undead and reinhabit the Isles with life and beauty.

Also Yorick don't forget him, he also seeks a way to end the current state of the Shadow Isles
Yorick isn't relevant to the conversation because I'm responding to the OP lumping Elise and Maokai in with the undead of the Isles in his main post.

The Frozen Watchers and the Void are the same thing, just from different regions. The Watchers are Void creatures.

There is also a few more that haven't been explored so we don't know if they are currently a threat or not, being {{champion:134}} and {{champion:45}} , although I have a suspicion that both of them might relate to the World Rune storyline, especially Veigar considering last time we checked the only thing he wants is ultimate power through arcane and dark magic, and nothing is more arcane and dark than a World Rune.

> [{quoted}](name=The God of Rams,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EozzzaTs,comment-id=001b,timestamp=2018-07-10T20:16:46.412+0000)

Indeed Frozen Watchers = Watchers described in the Void faction update.

In regards to Veigar, his staff does have a crystal on top of it, maybe when they update him it could be a World Rune instead.
Technically, the Darkin, the Void, and the Frozen Watchers should count as 1, since the Watchers are the origin of all of them.
And England is the origin of the United States. But they tend to think of themselves as very distinct thank you very much.

It doesn't matter what they think. What matters is what they are.

What they are is pawns for cosmic horrors. As all things should be.
Pawns that break free and start doing their own thing are no longer pawns. Even if their creator deludes themselves into thinking they are still in control.

Well to be fair, Lissandra,the shadow isles and Xerath don't want to destroy the world.

Lissandra believes that living in service of the watchers is the best thing for humanity,so she doesn't want the watchers to end the world,just to rule it.

Meanwhile Xerath wants to rule shurima(and possibly the world) himself(though who knows if he could blow up the planet accidentally if he gets free)

And the shadow isles might kill everything on the planet,but that wouldn't be the end of everything(especially if Mordekaiser is in control),sure it'd be a world full of undead,but it'd be still a world with sentient beings on it.

Zombies are sentient. However that's refered too as an apocalypse. 

The extinction of humanity i think is what makes an apocalypse.
I kinda feel like in the end "bad guys" will ruin plots of other bad guys cuz "its our world to end. dont get in the way of our apocalypse"

Maybe at some point we'll see the black mist clashing against the void.

Cloudy with a chance of THE END OF THE WORLD
Isn't there also Aurelion Sol with the whole "Just you wait till I'm free"?
You forgot the trickerster picking Zoe. That pretty much f up everything to come. (its a joke dont hunt me down.)

> [{quoted}](name=Camille Ferrøs,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EozzzaTs,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-07-09T22:25:59.659+0000)
>
> You forgot the trickerster picking Zoe. That pretty much f up everything to come. (its a joke dont hunt me down.)

Well, she *did* expose that World Rune for funsies in her flavor story.
I'm sure it wasn't that fun for Ryze when he had to start kicking, punching and biting to recover that Rune

Aurelion Sol getting free and deciding to actually burn the cosmos to catch Targon in the flame.
{{champion:136}}
Of course, he can't actually do that.
yes he can what makes you say that? hes a cosmic space dragon that existed at the start of creation or at least really close to the start

Ok and?

He still cant burn the entirety of the cosmos.
He can. He doesn't do that because for each targonian he'd kill, one of his stars would fade.

No.  He cant.

And thats not how the curse works...

>[...]_ Outraged, he fought these controlling impulses and attempted to break his bonds by force, only to discover that for each attack against his newfound masters, one of his stars vanished forever from the firmament._

>[...] _My heart shatters as the heavens are diminished in brutal retribution for turning my power on one of Targon’s own.
A sun is the price of a single Pantheon. This is the cost of my unfettered wrath. This is the kind of boorish sorcery I must deal with._

The first is from Aurelion Sol bio, the second form his color story.

Yes the curse looks to be more bound to acts of retailation rather than killing a Targonian so it is a bit different.

What makes you believe though that he can't do what he says himself (burning the cosmos)?

The curde works by destroying one of his stars whenever he disobeys not when he kills a targonian.

And he is arrogant and has a massive tendency to overexaggerate.

He's not as powerful as he likes to pretend.

Not just disobeying or just replying to Pantheon would have had its effects.

He surely can't burn it in a single breath/spell, but he is surely able to delete worlds at will considering that he can craft actual stars and not just the small ones that he used in the story.

He creates baby stars which then grow.

They arent even that big.

Theyre like 528 feet in diameter.
He can create far bigger ones as stated in the story.

When?

He creates baby stars and lets them grow.

I dont remember it ever stating he can outright create bigger ones.

>_ The base elements in the atmosphere rally to my cause, accreting into a plasmic anomaly. The swelling stardust detonates at my unspoken command. The result is a dwarf replica of one of my majestic glories burning in the depths of space. After all, I can’t fling a full-fledged star at this fragile world._

From 'Twin Dawns'.

Also, once crafted the star needs Aurelion Sol nourishment in order to stay alive or it becomes a supernova right before exhaling its last "breath" (as explained by him in the same story).

> [{quoted}](name=Stars Shaper,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EozzzaTs,comment-id=00180000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000004,timestamp=2018-07-11T08:08:49.276+0000)
>
> What part of a _**DWARF REPLICA**_ is hard to understand?
> 
> (sorry for the repost, the boards seem to have bugged out and show me this as a reply to my comment and not yours, so I tried to fix this).

Just wanted to let you know that science supports your position that if Sol created an actual star on/near a planet that planet would be not be livable in a very short period of time
